#Text=Alexander A. Balandin

#Text=Alexander A. Balandin is an electrical engineer and materials scientist known for his studies of phonons and excitons in nanostructures , experimental and theoretical investigation of thermal properties of graphene , electronic 1/f noise in novel materials and devices as well as for his works on practical applications of semiconductor nanostructures and graphene in electronics , optoelectronics and energy conversion .
#Text=Academic career
#Text=Alexander A. Balandin received his BS in 1989 and MS in 1991 degrees summa cum laude in Applied Physics and Mathematics from the Moscow Institute of Physics & Technology ( MIPT ) , Russia .
#Text=He received his second MS in 1995 and PhD in 1996 degrees in Electrical Engineering from the University of Notre Dame , USA .
#Text=From 1997 to 1999 , he worked as Research Engineer in the Device Research Laboratory at the University of California , Los Angeles ( UCLA ) .

#Text=In 1999 he joined the Department of Electrical Engineering , University of California , Riverside ( UCR ) , where he is Professor of Electrical Engineering and Founding Chair of Materials Science and Engineering ( MS&E ) .
#Text=He is Director of the Nano-Device Laboratory ( NDL ) , which he organized in 2000 .

#Text=In 2005 , he was a Visiting Professor at the University of Cambridge , U.K. As the Founding Chair of the interdisciplinary MS&E program , he led the UCR efforts for introducing BS , MS and PhD degrees in MS&E . [ 1 ]
#Text=Research
#Text=Professor Balandin ’s research interests are in the area of advanced materials , nanostructures and nanodevices for electronics , optoelectronics and renewable energy conversion .
#Text=He conducts both experimental and theoretical research .
#Text=Balandin and coworkers were among the pioneers of the field of phonon engineering . [ 2 ]

#Text=In 1998 , he published an influential paper on the effects of phonon spatial confinement on thermal conductivity of nanostructures [ 3 ] ( where the term “ phonon engineering ” likely appeared for the first time in a journal publication ) .
#Text=Phonon engineering finds application in thermoelectric energy conversion and thermal management of advanced electronics .
#Text=He has contributed to development of GaN technology by investigating heat conduction in GaN films [ 4 ] and studying 1/f noise in GaN devices . [ 5 ]
#Text=He advanced ZnO technology by studying excitonic effects , confined phonon and optical properties of wurtzite nanostructures . [ 6 ]
#Text=In 2008 , Balandin ’s group authored a highly cited paper on the first measurement of thermal conductivity of suspended graphene . [ 7 ]
#Text=In order to perform the first measurement of thermal properties of graphene , Balandin invented a new optothermal experiment technique based on Raman spectroscopy .

#Text=He and his coworkers explained theoretically why the intrinsic thermal conductivity of graphene can be higher than that of bulk graphite , [ 8 ] [ 9 ] and demonstrated experimentally the evolution of heat conduction when the system dimensionality changes from 2D ( graphene ) to 3D ( graphite ) . [ 10 ]
#Text=Balandin ’s group advanced the graphene field by demonstrating the low-noise top-gate graphene transistor [ 11 ] and graphene triple-mode amplifier and phase detector .
#Text=The layman description of the unusual thermal properties of graphene can be found in IEEE Spectrum feature article . [ 12 ]
#Text=Balandin 's group has also reported the first " graphene-like " mechanical exfoliation of atomically thin films of topological insulators [ 13 ] [ 14 ] and other materials . [ 15 ]

#Text=Balandin group ’s research achievements were highlighted in Nature , Nature Nanotechnology , IEEE Spectrum , MIT Technology Review , Materials Today , Physics World , nationally syndicated radio programs and other media worldwide .
#Text=Honors and awards
#Text=Balandin received the following honors and awards :
#Text=Fellow , The American Physical Society ( APS ) [ 16 ]
#Text=Fellow , IEEE [ 17 ]
#Text=IEEE Pioneer Award in Nanotechnology [ 18 ] [ 19 ] [ 20 ] [ 21 ] [ 22 ] [ 23 ]
#Text=Fellow , The Institute of Physics , U.K. ( IOP )
#Text=Fellow , The Optical Society of America [ 24 ]
#Text=Fellow , The International Society for Optical Engineering [ 25 ]
#Text=Fellow , American Association for the Advancement of Science [ 26 ]
#Text=National Science Foundation ( NSF ) Career Award
#Text=Office of Naval Research ( ONR )
#Text=Young Investigator Award
#Text=University of California Regents Award
#Text=The Merrill Lynch Innovation Award for “ commercially valuable engineering research ”
#Text=US Civil Research and Development Foundation
#Text=US Civil Research and Development Foundation ( CRDF )
#Text=Young Investigator Award
#Text=Eta Kappa Nu Engineering Honor Society
#Text=Medal from the Materials Research Society [ 1 ]
#Text=In 2018
#Text=Balandin had received two grants from DARPA and the Semiconductor Research Corporation . [ 27 ]

#Text=NDL research group conducts theoretical and experimental research on nanostructures and novel materials and their applications in electronics , optoelectronics and renewable energy conversion .
